intro: Habranthus lineatus, commonly known as the zigzag grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are often adorned with distinctive zigzag patterns along their edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in its natural habitat.
